common.member.role.description.MEMBER: Can view team, access and edit events, deliberate on proposals, and publish results. Cannot create events or manage team settings.
common.member.role.description.OWNER: Full control over team and events, including member management, event creation, and proposal publishing.
common.member.role.description.REVIEWER: Read-only access to team and events, with no editing or publishing rights.

event-management.publication.deliberatio: Proposals accepted or rejected by organizers
You need to mark proposals as accepted or rejected.
To deliberate, open the proposals page, select and mark proposals as accepted or rejected. You can also change the deliberation status individually on a proposal page.

JPEG, PNG, WEBP or AVIF formats supported with optimal resolution of 500x500. <0></0> 300kB max. You can optimize your logo with <1>squoosh.app</1>
event-management.settings.danger.archive: Archived events are not displayed anymore in the team list and in the Conference Hall search. Nothing is deleted, you can restore them when you want.

Sent when a proposal is accepted by the organizers
Sent when a proposal is rejected by the organizers

event-management.settings.emails.form.co: Use {{proposal}} placeholder to insert the proposal title.

event-management.settings.heading: Event settings
event-management.settings.integrations.o: Export speakers and proposals to <0>OpenPlanner</0>. OpenPlanner is a SaaS app for scheduling and managing conference talks. It integrates with Conference Hall to schedule accepted talks, add/edit speakers and sessions, manage tracks/rooms, and handle sponsors.

Once you've configured your OpenPlanner event ID and API key, go to the proposals page in Conference Hall and click <0>"Export > To OpenPlanner"</0>. If you've applied any filters on the proposals page, only the filtered proposals will be synchronized.
How to trigger the export to OpenPlanner?
event-management.settings.integrations.s: With Slack integration you will be able to received notifications about speakers in a dedicated Slack channel. Follow the 3 steps of the <0>Slack documentation</0> to get the Incoming Web Hook URL and choose the channel.
How to get the Slack web hook URL?
event-management.settings.menu.heading: Event settings menu

event-management.settings.reviews.enable: When disabled, reviewers won't be able to review proposals anymore.
event-management.settings.reviews.settin: When disabled, reviews of all team members and global note won't be visible.
Display reviews of all team members
When disabled, all speakers information are not visible. Used for anonymized reviews.

event-management.settings.tracks.categor: Define talk categories available for your event proposals.
Determines whether the input allows users to select multiple categories.
When a speaker submit a proposal, the category selection is mandatory.
event-management.settings.tracks.formats: Define talk formats available for your event proposals.
Determines whether the input allows users to select multiple formats.
When a speaker submit a proposal, the format selection is mandatory.
event-management.settings.web-api.descri: Use the HTTP API if you want to connect a service to some Conference Hall event.
event-management.settings.web-api.info: The web API is limited to <0>60 requests per hour</0> maximum to avoid server overload by external services.
event-management.settings.web-api.tryout: List event proposals, you can filters them around different criterias.
